title: Old stock or second hand original parts

posts.content: Who would be best to ring? I'm after a inlet manifold for a stock 1500sp. Would prefer to go original rather than aftermarket.

Have a look on thesamba, or EBay.

Try Mega bug:

author.location: Bridgnorth, Shropshire. I am a member :o)

posts.content:
Blimey - there must be loads of these around, (or been tossed!) from various twin carb upgrades.
I have one myself - but I'm keeping it!! (:^P)
I would have thought an appeal on here or (dare I say) FaceBook should unearth one fairly quickly.

1500 / 1600 Single port Manifolds - £30 each

http://www.partsemporium.co.uk/type%202 ... spares.htm

Unfortunately what you are after is actually very hard to find nowadays .

95% of Second hand single port inlet manifolds have the preheat tubes completely coked up solid. This causes the carb to constantly ice up (even on hot days...) which in turn makes the motor run like sh1t. I have not ever successfully managed to clear a heavily blocked preheat tube and I`ve tried every method you can possibly think of... Basically if the preheats are blocked solid - the manifold is pretty much dead.

NOS is the way to go if you can find it... I searched for ages about three years ago for a NOS one, eventually found one, paid a lot of ££££ for it but was just relived to have found one!

BEWARE - prior to searching for the NOS one I though I had no other option but to give the repros a go. Bought one, didn`t fit sent it back. Supplied with a replacement, still didn`t fit, sent it back for refund and gave up.

A good tip to unblock them is...a brake cable outer part in a battery drill and just keep boring through.
Every few mins cut the end of the cable of to keep it sharp.
Once your through bend the end and go through again.

An original exhaust has a through pipe on the pre heat side ,so they shouldn't carbon so much.
So the heat goes in one end and exits out the tail pipe.

Dave
